title: Google\Cloud\Batch\V1\AllocationPolicy\Disk
name: Disk
description:
A new persistent disk or a local ssd.

A VM can only have one local SSD setting but multiple local SSD partitions. https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks#pdspecs. https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks#localssds.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.batch.v1.AllocationPolicy.Disk

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.image
params.description: Name of a public or custom image used as the data source.

params.name: data.snapshot
params.description: Name of a snapshot used as the data source.

params.name: data.type
params.description: Disk type as shown in gcloud compute disk-types list For example, "pd-ssd", "pd-standard", "pd-balanced", "local-ssd".

params.name: data.size_gb
params.description: Disk size in GB. This field is ignored if data_source is disk or image. If type is local-ssd, size_gb should be a multiple of 375GB, otherwise, the final size will be the next greater multiple of 375 GB.

params.name: data.disk_interface
params.description: Local SSDs are available through both "SCSI" and "NVMe" interfaces. If not indicated, "NVMe" will be the default one for local ssds. We only support "SCSI" for persistent disks now.

methods.name: getDiskInterface
methods.description:
